page.title: 12LAINDON CHILDREN PROTEST
page.content: In the debate concerning the proposed newtown of{Tillingham Hall,}the villagers of{Bulphan and West Horndon, maintain that the town will ruin the countryside and destroy wildlife and farmland. More importantly they argue that if permission is given for building on this area of green belt land then this will set a precedent for building on green belt land in other areas. Our class discussed the situation and decided unanimously that permission for the town should not be given because despite the jobs and housing the town would supply, if a precedent is set for building on green belt land then other firms will want to build on green belt land and eventuallly there will be little countryside left for trees, plants and wildlife.
